series.title: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: The Shins' James Mercer, the cast of Goon 2, Jody Mitic 03/06/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: The Shins' James Mercer discusses his band's upcoming album. Goon 2's Jay Baruchel, Elisha Cuthbert and Marc-André Grondin on the sequel to the popular hockey movie. Canada Reads panellist Jody Mitic defends his pick, M.G. Vassanji's Nostalgia.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Jenn Grant, Jon Tattrie, Ry Russo-Young 03/03/2017
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Today on q hosted by Tom Power: Jenn Grant on how dreams inspired her new album Paradise, Nova Scotia's secret connection to a Bob Marley classic, director Ry Russo-Young reinvents the 'mean girl' in coming-of-age stories.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Leif Vollebekk, She Has a Name, Macon Blair 03/02/2017
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Today on q hosted by Tom Power: Musician Leif Vollebekk finds the emotion in his old songs, Andrew and Matt Kooman take on human trafficking in their new film 'She Has a Name,' director Macon Blair

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Marlee Matlin, Giles Blunt, Sampha 03/01/2017
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Today on q, hosted by Tom Power: Marlee Matlin on why Switched at Birth isn't just for the deaf, author Giles Blunt's musical tribute to North Bay, musician Sampha on confronting pain in his work, and more.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Mandy Moore, Louis Gossett Jr., Five Faces For Evelyn Frost 02/28/2017
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Today on q, hosted by Tom Power: Mandy Moore, Louis Gossett Jr., Five Faces for Evelyn Frost on our dangerous obsession with image, and more.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Recapping the 2017 Oscars, k.d. lang, Samora Pinderhughes 02/27/2017
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Today on q, hosted by Tom Power:Recapping the 2017 Oscars, k.d. lang, Samora Pinderhughes and more

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Raoul Peck, the origin story of the Oscars statue, Black Lives Black Words' Reggie Edmund 02/24/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Raoul Peck discusses his latest film, I Am Not Your Negro. Author Jim Piazza gives us the origin story of the Oscars statue. Reggie Edmund and artist Motion discuss the new play Black Lives, Black Words.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Jordan Peele, Ziyian Kwan, Humble the Poet, Art in Ad Places, Justin Hurwitz, Andy Kindler 02/23/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Jordan Peele on his new film, Get Out. Ziyian Kwan's new dance piece, Kwan Yin. Canada Reads' Humble the Poet. Art in Ad Places project tackles sexism and consumerism in public spaces. Justin Hurwitz's gateway to musicals. Andy Kindler on bad comedy.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Japandroids, photographer Chris Buck, screenwriter Mike Carey 02/22/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Japandroids return with a new album and expanded sound. Photographer Chris Buck on making celebrities feel uneasy in front of the camera. Writer Mike Carey combines the zombie genre with a coming-of-age story in The Girl With All the Gifts.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Hamilton Leithauser, Louis Theroux, the origin story of podcasts, Denham Jolly 02/21/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Musician Hamilton Leithauser on finding a new friend and collaborator in Rostam. Louis Theroux dives into the world of Scientology in his film. The origin story of podcasting. Denham Jolly on launching Canada's first black-owned radio station.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Family Day edition: Dan Zanes, Kate Beaton, Lisa Loeb 02/20/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Dan Zane's journey from garage rock to children's music. Kate Beaton on the joys of writing for kids. Lisa Loeb reveals the nostalgic reason behind her kids' album.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Bill and Joel Plaskett, Anna Paquin, Pete Holmes 02/17/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Father-and-son musicians Bill and Joel Plaskett discuss their first collaborative album, Solidarity. Actress Anna Paquin on the new CBC drama, Bellevue. Comedian Pete Holmes explains his path to comedy and his new HBO show, Crashing.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: A tribute to Stuart McLean, Candy Palmater on Canada Reads, Jan Lisiecki, Jovanka Vuckovic 02/16/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: The Vinyl Cafe's music producer Julie Penner and band the Good Lovelies on Stuart McLean. Candy Palmater on her Canada Reads book pick. Jan Lisiecki takes on Schumann on his latest album. Jovanka Vuckovic on her new horror film, XX.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Author Veronica Roth, comedian Nate Bargatze, DJ Kid Koala 02/15/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Author Veronica Roth follows up her successful Divergent series with Carve the Mark. Nate Bargatze on why we should stop labelling comedians clean or dirty. Kid Koala combats cabin fever with his tranquil new album, Music to Draw to: Satellite.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Colin James, Workin' Moms' Catherine Reitman, author Heather O'Neill, James Rhodes 02/14/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Colin James pays tribute to the blues greats on his latest album. Catherine Reitman brings her personal experiences to Workin' Moms. Heather O'Neill provides a playlist for Montreal's Plateau. James Rhodes on how music helped him through dark times.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Elan Mastai, John Darnielle, q's Grammy recap & more 02/13/2017
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Screenwriter Elan Mastai on his hotly anticipated blockbuster novel, "All Our Wrong Todays," q's recap of the 59th Annual Grammy Awards, John Darnielle takes us back to the VHS rental stores of the 1990's & more

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Michael Kaeshammer, Simon Wynberg on Exit: Music, composer Ramin Djawadi 02/10/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Pianist Michael Kaeshammer on his genre evolution, from jazz to boogie-woogie. Simon Wynberg discusses the new documentary, Exit: Music. Composer Ramin Djawadi breaks down his work for Game of Thrones and Westworld.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Drive-By Truckers, Kid Koala, Northern Cree's Steve Wood 02/09/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Drive-By Truckers discuss the unexpected importance of their latest album, post-election. Kid Koala gives us a gateway into the world of turntablism. Northern Cree's Steve Wood on the group's Grammy nomination and performance this year.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Eric Braeden, the origin story of soap operas, celebrating this year's Juno nominees, Daisy Goodwin 02/08/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Actor Eric Braeden looks back on 37 years of being a soap star. The origin story of soap operas. Revisiting Juno-nominated q guests who have been on the show. Victoria producer Daisy Goodwin on the incredible story of Queen Victoria.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: One Day at a Time co-creator Gloria Calderon Kellett, The A Word writer Peter Bowker, Chris de Burgh 02/07/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Gloria Calderon Kellett brings her personal experiences the to reboot of One Day at a Time. Peter Bowker shines a light on aspects of autism in The A Word. Chris de Burgh looks back on his enduring success and hit song "Lady in Red."

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: The Doors' Robby Krieger, Almost Adults' Adrianna DiLonardo and Sarah Rotella, Anosh Irani 02/06/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Robby Krieger celebrates the 50th anniversary of The Doors' debut album. Adrianna DiLonardo and Sarah Rotella discuss their new film Almost Adults. Anosh Irani tells a personal story through the sport of cricket in his new play.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: A.R. Rahman, Letterkenny's Jared Keeso, Interrupt This Program's Nabil Mehchi and Frank Fiorito 02/03/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: A.R. Rahman reflects on 25 years of making music and scoring films. Actor Jared Keeso gives a musical tribute to the fictional town of Letterkenny. The creators of Interrupt This Program discuss the show's second season.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: National Arts Centre's Jill Keiley, David Adjaye, Lido Pimienta 02/02/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: National Arts Centre director Jill Keiley takes on the stage production of The Colony of Unrequited Dreams. Architect David Adjaye designs the first National African-American Museum of History and Culture. Artist Lido Pimienta finds freedom in music.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Riverdale creator Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa, Khari Wendell McClelland, Ohad Naharin 02/01/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Roberto Aguirre-Sacasa on Riverdale's dark twist on the classic Archie comics. Khari Wendell McClelland traces his ancestors' path to freedom through music. Gaga movement originator Ohad Naharin explains the physicality of this unique dance form.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Narcy, Asghar Farhadi, Aparna Nancherla, Canada Reads finalists, Measha Brueggergosman 01/31/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Artist Narcy speaks out on the Quebec City mosque shooting. Director Asghar Farhadi on making films in Iran. How comedian Aparna Nancherla tackled her shyness. The Canada Reads finalists are revealed. Measha Brueggergosman delivers Songs of Freedom.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Fiona Reid, comedian Trae Crowder, rapper T.I. 01/30/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Actress Fiona Reid takes on the role of the Queen in The Audience. Liberal Redneck Trae Crowder on balancing the pride and shame of being a Southerner. Rapper T.I. discusses the political motivation behind his new album.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Kent Monkman, Michael Fassbender, John Early and Kate Berlant, Nova Bhattacharya 01/27/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Kent Monkman explores First Nations' resilience through art. How Michael Fassbender prepares for his roles. John Early and Kate Berlant put a surrealist touch on Hollywood ruthlessness in 555. Nova Bhattacharya uses dance to explore her migraines.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Celebrating Mary Tyler Moore, Clara Hughes, Gordon Pinsent, Catherine Bainbridge and Taboo 01/26/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Writers Susan Silver and Katie Ford open up about working with Mary Tyler Moore. Clara Hughes discusses Canada Reads. Gordon Pinsent on a new documentary about his life. Catherine Bainbridge's new film focuses on the Indigenous influence on rock history.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Bebe Rexha, Karine Vanasse, Ryan McMahon, Nabil Elderkin 01/25/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: How Bebe Rexha honed her craft to write some of pop’s biggest hits. Karine Vanasse on her latest role on crime drama Cardinal. Ryan McMahon's musical tribute to Treaty 3 in Northwestern Ontario. How Nabil Elderkin became one of music's go-to photographers

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Kiva Reardon and Albert Shin on Oscar nominations, Johann Johansson, Steve Aoki, Caroline Dhavernas 01/24/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Kiva Reardon and Albert Shin on Oscar nominations. Johann Johannsson on scoring Arrival and the upcoming Blade Runner film.  Steve Aoki's musical picks for EDM newbies. Caroline Dhavernas is a complicated killer on new TV series Mary Kills People.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Matthew McConaughey, Irene Taylor Brodsky, Sandra Shamas 01/23/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Matthew McConaughey looks to his dad for inspiration for new film Gold. Irene Taylor Brodsky explores the faceless power of Slenderman in her new documentary. Sandra Shamas explores life after 50 in her show The Big 'What Now?'

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Barry Crimmins, The Love Boat's Ted Lange, director Zacharias Kunuk 01/20/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Barry Crimmins gives comedians advice on how to deal with the Trump presidency. Actor Ted Lange looks back at The Love Boat's 40-year legacy. Zacharias Kunuk re-imagines the classic Western in his new film, Searchers.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Gad Elmaleh, artist Adrienne Wong, Rose Cousins 01/19/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: 'I want to earn those laughs': Gad Elmaleh brings his comedy to an American audience. How Adrienne Wong’s Landline aims to connect people in cities across Canada. How Rose Cousins managed her stress while recording Natural Conclusion.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Letterkenny's Jared Keeso, author Jael Richardson, Pitchfork editor Stacey Anderson, artist Sonny Assu 01/18/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Letterkenny star Jared Keeso on his small town upbringing. Books contributor Jael Richardson recommends Nicola Yoon's The Sun is Also a Star. Pitchfork's Stacey Anderson gives us an Obama-themed playlist. Artist Sonny Assu on his latest exhibit.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Rick Mercer, ‘The Spoon Lady’ Abby Roach, Ecuadorian musician Daniel Lofredo Rota 01/17/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Rick Mercer on pursuing your passions: 'You have to love your subject matter.’ Why 'The Spoon Lady' Abby Roach is recording America's buskers. Why Daniel Lofredo Rota is bringing his grandfather's lost recordings back to life.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Austra, Hatecopy, DJ Rupture on Julius Eastman 01/16/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Austra's Katie Stelmanis on the science fiction and politics that went into their new album. Maria Qamar, a.k.a. Hatecopy, satirizes her culture while bringing people together through her brand of pop art. DJ Rupture on the music of Julius Eastman.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Friends producer Kevin S. Bright, soprano Ambur Braid, actor Don McKellar 01/13/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Friends producer Kevin S. Bright says he tried to 'always keep the show honest.’ 'You have to be so zen': How soprano Ambur Braid hits the high notes in her new performance. Don McKellar revives the Michael comedy series this winter on CBC-TV.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Candy Palmater, Arun Lakra, Peter Engel 01/12/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Candy Palmater opens up about her recent interview with Joseph Boyden about the controversy surrounding his heritage. Arun Lakra discusses his new play Sequence. Peter Engel on creating Saved By the Bell & the time he almost made a show with John Lennon.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Kelly Mantle, WNYC producer Sara Fishko, director Fraser Munden, Colin Linden 01/11/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Kelly Mantle is the first gender-fluid actor eligible for an Oscar. Sara Fishko uncovers The Jazz Loft in her documentary. A Montreal legend comes to life in the animated film The Chaperone. Colin Linden takes the stage with the cast of Nashville.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Ali Hassan, WOMANPRODUCER, The Trocks' artistic director Tory Dobrin 01/10/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Comedian Ali Hassan on how the U.S. election has affected his jokes. WOMANPRODUCER highlights the hidden history of female music producers. Artistic director Tory Dobrin explains his playful spin on classical ballet.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Charlotte Cardin, Asperger’s Are Us director Alex Lehmann, Eugene Levy 01/09/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: From La Voix to opening for Sting: Charlotte Cardin's patient rise to success. Alex Lehmann leaves the comedy to the comedians in his new documentary Asperger's Are Us. Eugene Levy is back for season three of Schitt's Creek.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Ryan Robbins, ocean artist Peter Matthews, Simply Saucer, Danny Michel 01/06/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Ryan Robbins plays a Mennonite pastor with a dangerous secret in CBC's Pure. Peter Matthews' ocean art. Hamilton band Simply Saucer detail their story of underground success in new book. How 24,000 horsepower helped fuel Danny Michel's new album.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Krief, artist Laolu Senbanjo, audiobook historian Matthew Rubery, mini food artist Jay Baron 01/05/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Krief performs and discusses his latest album. Laolu Senbanjo explains the meaning behind his body art. Matthew Rubery shares the origin story of the audiobook. Artist Jay Baron brings joy to audiences with his mini food art.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Sex Pistols' Steve Jones, A Tribe Called Red's 2oolman, author Jason Diamond, Hulk writer Mariko Tamaki 01/04/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Steve Jones revisits his Sex Pistols days in his new memoir. A Tribe Called Red member 2oolman's musical tribute to Six Nations of the Grand River. Author Jason Diamond gives us a John Hughes-inspired playlist. Mariko Tamaki on the new Hulk comic series.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: The xx, Boarder X, Potted Potter, Kevin McDonald 01/03/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: The xx on their new album. Boarder X explores the intersections between Indigenous culture and boarding culture. Potted Potter condenses all seven Harry Potter books into one stage show. Kevin McDonald brings the old and new together in his new podcast.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Celebrities we lost in 2016, The Jerry Cans, blind film critic Tommy Edison, director Deepa Mehta 01/02/17
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Guest host Laurie Brown speaks to art director Roger Christian about the celebrities we lost in 2016 including Carrie Fisher and George Michael. The Jerry Cans perform. Film critic Tommy Edison. Anatomy of Violence director Deepa Mehta.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Celebrating the anniversaries of Beastie Boys' Licensed to Ill and Amy Winehouse's Back to Black, the origin story of emojis, Oliver Jones, Andre Alexis, Thomas Dolby 12/30/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Looking at the 30th anniversary of Beastie Boys' Licensed to Ill and the 10th anniversary of Amy Winehouse's Back to Black. The origin story of emojis. Oliver Jones performs. Andre Alexis pays tribute to Parkdale. Thomas Dolby's musical history.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Lars Ulrich, Mohawk Girls, Marc Myers breaks down the anatomy of iconic songs, Norwegian musician Aurora 12/29/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Lars Ulrich, Mohawk Girls brings Indigenous female perspectives to TV, Marc Myers breaks down the anatomy of iconic songs in his new book, Norwegian artist Aurora is on the hunt for the right songs.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Michael Stipe and Mike Mills, Chris Gethard, DJ A-Trak, the cast of Come From Away 12/28/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: R.E.M.'s Michael Stipe and Mike Mills reflect on their 1991 album Out of Time, how Chris Gethard slices through depression with jokes, 4 remixes that inspired A-Trak to become the DJ and producer he is today, the cast of Come From Away perform.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Robbie Robertson, Tegan and Sara, Katherena Vermette, Barry Jenkins 12/27/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Robbie Robertson discusses his new memoir, Testimony. Tegan and Sara on 20 years of making music together. Katherena Vermette's musical tribute to Winnipeg's North End. Barry Jenkins tackles black masculinity in Moonlight.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Marina Abramovic, the origin story of Auto-Tune, A Tribe Called Red, the music and life of Sharon Jones, Gordon Lightfoot 12/26/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Marina Abramovic tackles her fears in her art. The origin story of Auto-Tune. A Tribe Called Red on pushing Indigenous music to the forefront. The music and life of Sharon Jones. Gordon Lightfoot discusses songwriting, exercise and Leonard Cohen.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Zadie Smith, director Steven Okazaki, The OA's Brit Marling and Zal Batmanglij, Caitlin Moran 12/23/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Author Zadie Smith discusses her new book, Swing Time. Director Steven Okazaki explores the legacy of Toshiro Mifune's samurai films. Brit Marling and Zal Batmanglij on creating mystery around The OA. Caitlin Moran pays tribute to Crouch End, London.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Star Trek writers D. C. Fontana and David Gerrold, Zaki Ibrahim, comedian Jonny Donahoe, Stop Podcasting Yourself creators, Okilly Dokilly band 12/22/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Star Trek original series writers. Zaki Ibrahim's musical tribute to Woodstock, Cape Town. Jonny Donahoe's show gets the audience to share personal stories about depression. Stop Podcasting Yourself creators. Okilly Dokilly band.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Damien Chazelle, the Not at the Dinner Table project, Andrew Gulli, Anne Donahue 12/21/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Director Damien Chazelle discusses his new film, La La Land. The Not at the Dinner Table project makes voicemails a cathartic experience. Andrew Gulli on finding an undiscovered H.G. Wells story. Anne Donahue shares her must-binge shows over the holidays.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Ted Chiang, Kinley Dowling, Teenagers creator M. H. Murray, Todd Mayfield on his father 12/20/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Sci-fi writer Ted Chiang on his story's adaptation into the film Arrival. Hey Rosetta!’s Kinley Dowling on her solo album. M. H. Murray doesn't gloss over the gritty details of being a teenager in his web series. Todd Mayfield on his dad Curtis Mayfield.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Martha Wainwright, Dr. Seuss expert Jeff Schuffman, Twerkumentary director Diana Manfredi 12/19/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Martha Wainwright looks ahead on her new album, Goodnight City. Dr. Seuss expert Jeff Schuffman explains the story behind the writer's taxidermy art. Twerkumentary gets to the bottom of twerking's origins.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Lisa Loeb, Hawksley Workman, Canadian Music Class Challenge, Sean Cullen and Patrick McKenna 12/16/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Lisa Loeb on the nostalgic reason behind her kids' albums. Hawksley Workman's Christmas album was a celebration of his grandmother. CBC Music is looking for Canada's best music class. How Second City's Twist Your Dickens reinvents a Christmas classic.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Barry director Vikram Gandhi, Pokemon theme song singer Jason Paige, the origin story of Handel's Messiah, The Good Lovelies 12/15/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Barry director Vikram Gandhi discusses the story of Barack Obama. The voice behind Pokemon's theme song on the franchise's resurgence. The origin story of Handel's Messiah. The Good Lovelies perform live at Sounds of the Season.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Tom Green on Alan Thicke, Gael García Bernal, Sloan’s Chris Murphy, Inuk singer Susan Aglukark 12/14/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Tom Green on the death of friend Alan Thicke. Gael García Bernal explores the political power of poetry in his new film Neruda. Hear Sloan's Chris Murphy perform. Why Susan Aglukark is tacking Northern Canada's food crisis.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Lizzo, illusionist Darcy Oake, Koen Vanmechelen's Cosmopolitan Chicken Project, Patrick Haggerty 12/13/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Rapper Lizzo discusses body positivity. Illusionist Darcy Oake on the recent David Blaine controversy. The message behind artist Koen Vanmechelen's Cosmopolitan Chicken Project. Country singer Patrick Haggerty re-releases his historical 1973 album.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Riz Ahmed, La La Land composer Justin Hurwitz, Andrew Baulcomb's musical tribute to Hamilton, Sebastian Bach 12/12/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Actor Riz Ahmed. La La Land composer Justin Hurwitz. Andrew Baulcomb's musical tribute to Hamilton. Sebastian Bach.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Miss Sloane director John Madden, the origin story of emojis, Trevor Noah, Canadian play Creeps, BROS 12/09/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Miss Sloane director John Madden looks at how his film reflects the recent U.S. election. The origin story of the emoji. Trevor Noah's musical tribute to Soweto. Forty-five years of Canadian play Creeps. Saskatoon band BROS performs live.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Alan Thicke, Emma Donoghue's musical tribute to Dublin, comedian Nina Conti, DJ Red Robinson, director and actor Michael Seater 12/08/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Alan Thicke plays a not so perfect father. Emma Donoghue's musical tribute to Dublin. Nina Conti reveals the 'subversive witchery' of ventriloquism. DJ Red Robinson on meeting rock & roll's greatest. Michael Seater tackles teenage anxiety in his new film.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Tom Cochrane, Jarrett Martineau on Gord Downie, graphic designer Paul Rand, the 2017 Grammy nominations 12/07/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Tom Cochrane looks back on his hit song, "Life is a Highway." Revolutions Per Minute co-founder Jarrett Martineau on Gord Downie's recent Assembly of First Nations honour. The work of graphic designer Paul Rand. A look at this year's Grammy nominations.

episodes.seriesTitle: Q: The Podcast from CBC Radio
episodes.title: Reggie Watts, Josh Gondelman, Blind Film Critic Tommy Edison, Filmmaker Deepa Mehta 12/06/16
episodes.author: podcasting@cbc.ca
episodes.summary: Reggie Watts' post-election advice: 'Make stuff, do stuff'. Josh Gondelman's gateway comedy album for standup newbies. Blind film critic Tommy Edison. Anatomy of Violence director Deepa Mehta.
